content.title: Colorectal Cancer
content.definition: Third most common cancer, importance of screening and molecular profiling
content.statement: Colorectal Cancer is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Oncology that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Colorectal Cancer helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Colorectal Cancer include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Colorectal Cancer.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
